body.p: The list below is just some suggestions made by various members of the GStreamer community. We are more than happy for students to make proposals based on their own wishes and ideas instead of using any of these suggestions. The important part for us is that you are motivated and that you put good work into writing a good and detailed proposal and that you try to interact with us from the start. Try to early find a possible mentor and shape your proposal (e.g. using Google docs).
body.h1: List of Summer of Code project ideas for students

ul.li: plugins
Editing Plugins: Wrapping much-needed audio/video filters as gstreamer plugins.
zrtp Support: Write plugins to support zRTP
Chapter Support: Implement chapter support in more plugins
OpenCV Gesture Detection : Implement an opencv plugin for gesture detection (eg: hand gesture)
DASH WebM support: Implement a plugin to do WebM DASH streaming
Improved Subtitle support : Work on subtitle support in Muxers
GStreamer & OpenGL : Project ideas for improving OpenGL support in GStreamer
CoreAnimation plugin for Apple platforms : CoreAnimation video sink (also useful for iOS)
applications
Pitivi: Improve Pitivi
Buzztrax: Improve Buzztrax music composer
framework
Closed_Captioning_support: Subtitles for the hearing impaired
Multichannel_grabber_card_support : Multichannel video grabber card support and more baseclasses
GeneratedFormatTestdata: Generate robustness testdata for demuxer/parser tests
Orc Acceleration: Extend use of the Orc optimizations in GStreamer
bindings
Gstreamer-Lua : Gstreamer Lua binding enhancement
Gstreamer-Java enhancement : GStreamer Java binding enhancement, GStreamer and GStreamer-Java Mac OS and Windows port
Port GStreamer applications and/or plugins from 0.10 to 0.11/1.0
Automatic low-level Java binding generation : Automatically generate the low-level layer of gstreamer-java

JavaScript bindings : Since GNOME picked JavaScript as a preferred language for desktop apps, it would be good to have someone verify that it works with GStreamer and write some sample apps and tutorials.
